intro: Achyrocline venosa, commonly known as the velvetleaf ironweed, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central and South America. It is characterized by its hairy, velvety leaves and clusters of small, pale pink to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, tropical environments and is often found in coastal areas or near water sources. Its flowers bloom during the dry season, and the plant is known for its aromatic foliage. Achyrocline venosa has been used in traditional medicine for its potential anti-inflammatory and antimicrobial properties.
